item.title: Learning Object-Oriented Programming
item.description:
In this project, I delved into the basics of object-oriented programming. In Python, I implemented:

  • Classes and methods
  • Inheritance and method overriding
  • Using super() to call a parent class
  • Abstract classes and interfaces via the abc module
  • Simple applications using classes, such as order simulation, library management, and geometric shape calculations

OOP helps structure code to make it scalable, understandable, and reusable. This approach is widely used in developing large, maintainable software systems. Working with OOP was a significant milestone in my professional growth as an aspiring programmer.

item.title: Project Management and Digital Transformation: Implementing IT Technologies in Business Processes
item.description:
In an environment of increasing project complexity and the need for rapid adaptation to change, implementing IT tools has become an essential component of effective project management. In my practice, I apply hybrid methodologies that combine elements of Agile, Kanban, and traditional approaches.

Key Steps in Digital Transformation for Project Management:

  • Automating planning and control processes using Notion and Trello.
  • Centralizing documentation storage and communications.
  • Integrating development and management tools (GitHub Projects).
  • Visualizing progress and performance metrics.
  • Systematizing task assignments, deadlines, and responsibilities.

These changes have reduced time spent on routine tasks, increased transparency for the team and clients, and improved quality control.

Digital transformation is not limited to adopting a single toolâ€”it represents a philosophy of continuous process improvement. My approach is built on openness to experimentation, adaptability, and continuous feedback.

item.title: IT Conference in Paris: New Horizons of Technology
item.description:
The Tech & Innovation Summit Paris 2025 conference took place at the modern Station F technology hub, gathering over 5,000 participants from around the world. The program was packed with events, from morning keynote speeches to evening networking sessions and hands-on workshops.

Highlights included:

  • A presentation by a Google expert on AI ethics and algorithm transparency.
  • A panel discussion on cybersecurity in the age of quantum computing.
  • Workshops on creating sustainable software solutions using Python and Go.

I also visited several startup booths showcasing innovations in healthcare, smart city infrastructure, and education. The conference atmosphere was inspiring and reminded me how rapidly technology evolves.

This event not only enriched my knowledge but also marked an important milestone in my professional journey as an aspiring developer.
